titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Enoch Faw diary, 1851-1857
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, May 2019

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Typescript of the diary of Enoch Faw while attending the Randolph County, N.C., Normal College (now Duke University), 1851-1856, and while reading law under General A.J. Hansell in Marietta, Ga., 1856-1857. The diary contains comments on courses and books, expenses, social events, religion, the weather, girl friends, contemplation of suicide, enlisting in the war, and Faw family genealogical data.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Enoch Faw diary, 1851-1857, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, May 2019.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Typescript of the diary of Enoch Faw while attending the Randolph County, N.C., Normal College (now Duke University), 1851-1856, and while reading law under General A.J. Hansell in Marietta, Ga., 1856-1857. The diary contains comments on courses and books, expenses, social events, religion, the weather, girl friends, contemplation of suicide, enlisting in the war, and Faw family genealogical data.
